mainText.attr1: Move Command:
A great tool - prep your ships for an attack, or position them for defense.
Move to a position command (or just move command) is a bit more intricate than other commands.
Move Command Use:
To start a move command - select one or more ships.
Now right click on empty space.
Position the marker.
Left click to confirm.
Advanced Use:
A move command can have multiple way points.
Hold the SHIFT key to chain way points (see top image on right).
The left click without the SHIFT key will be the final point.
Useful for avoiding obstacles or positioning the final orientation.
A move command can be higher/lower than the ship(s)
Hold the ALT key then move the mouse to raise/lower the marker
Most of the time you want to go to - near something else.
Positioning in 3D space can be challenging.
That's why there's help!
Example:
Look at the two images on the right - I intended the ship to go to the base.
But the ship would actually end up above where I intended.
3D position assist:
If you want 3D position assist to kick in.
Move the go to marker over another object.
Press and hold the CTRL key.
The marker will snap to the object's position in 3D space.
Let go of the CTRL key and move the go to marker away from the object to desired spot.
Then left click to confirm.
Another cool thing:
Remember the - camera focus on - key? (default F)
Press it while issuing a move command - the camera will focus on the marker.
Let's you see positions off screen. Don't forget you can zoom in/out as well.
And Another cool thing: The 3D position assist - snap to object - works on rally points and nav markers as well.
